segments.text: I see the woman’s dress swaying slightly as she moves, completely absorbed in her chore.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems to find solace in that repetitive action of drying the dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But her calmness is deceptive; there’s chaos bubbling just out of her sight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The little boy is climbing the stool, reaching for cookies, and I can't look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so close to the jar, and yet it all seems so precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I catch a glimpse of the girl’s hopeful face, and it makes me smile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her anticipation is infectious; I find myself rooting for them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Isn’t it funny how childhood mischief can evoke such mixed feelings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I can’t shake off the uneasy sensation in my gut; it’s a fine line they’re walking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice everything that is happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR
